summary: This is a Department of Justice Office of the Inspector General forensic examination report analyzing three BOP-issued Samsung Galaxy S9 phones to determine if they contained unauthorized communications related to Jeffrey Epstein's suicide. The manual review found only one message related to Epstein, which was an appropriate exchange reiterating staff instructions not to comment on the matter.

events.title: Forensic device receipt and review
events.description: OIG Cyber Investigations Office received and began manual review of three BOP-issued Samsung Galaxy S9 phones to search for unauthorized communications related to Epstein's death.

events.title: Formal forensic examination request
events.description: Submitted OIG Digital Forensics Examination Request form seeking review of Devices 1-3 for data related to Epstein's suicide.

locations: Metropolitan Correctional Center, New York, NY
keyFacts: The forensic examination found only one message related to Epstein across three BOP-issued phones, which was an appropriate exchange reiterating staff instructions not to comment on the matter.
The manual review was conducted to limit disruption of service and minimize intrusiveness, as there were no specific allegations of misconduct against the BOP employees who used the devices.
The examination was part of an investigation into alleged BOP employee misconduct related to Epstein's suicide, though no inappropriate communications were found.
All documentation from the forensic request was retained on the Archive Network Attached Storage in the New York City lab under case number 2019-010614.
